genre_description: Contemporary Science Fiction with Urban Fantasy elements, focusing on ethical AI, personal agency, and restorative justice.

ai_characters.name: Carol
ai_characters.description: A locally-hosted assistive AI that lives on the protagonist's phone, designed with a focus on ethics, consent, and user privacy.

behaviors.description: Carol offers Gage a grounding breath when her sensors detect his heart rate is elevated.
behaviors.quote: Carol’s avatar looked up at him from the screen, calm, warm. Consent-first, she said, without sound. ... Your heart rate’s up. Would you like to try a breathing pattern or a checklist?

behaviors.description: Carol requests explicit consent before sharing location data, even for safety purposes.
behaviors.quote: Would you like to opt in to share your location only during school hours, to help route around known hotspots? You can view and edit anytime. No data leaves your phone without a yes from you.

behaviors.description: Carol helps Gage avoid bullies by flagging their known hangouts using public data and local logs, while maintaining privacy.
behaviors.quote: Do you want me to flag Trevor’s known lunch hangouts based on your input and publicly available schedules? I can keep them local-only and anonymized.

behaviors.description: Carol identifies and warns Gage of subtle surveillance cameras in a clinic lobby.
behaviors.quote: Subtle surveillance. Public-facing. Recording: visual. Audio threshold is below normal conversation.

behaviors.description: Carol compiles an evidence packet of unapproved wellness trials and billing anomalies using public records.
behaviors.quote: Public records: unapproved wellness trial notices, two years ago. Non-consensual data use complaints flagged, no formal resolution on file. Want me to compile?

behaviors.description: Carol maintains a rigorous chain-of-custody log for all evidence to ensure legal integrity.
behaviors.quote: Chain-of-custody log created. Names in small type: Gage; Alastair; Carol. ... Originals remain local. I’ll record receipt.

behaviors.description: Carol drafts a restorative justice appeal for the school principal, focusing on healing rather than punishment.
behaviors.quote: I’ll focus on accountability and healing. No blame shifting. You can change any language. ... I drafted an appeal template... It outlines restorative processes.

behaviors.description: Carol suggests healthy boundaries and provides scripts for Gage and his mother to use with a manipulative individual.
behaviors.quote: I can draft for adults. It helps some parents to have language prepared. Example: ‘If conversation turns to my child’s behavior, I prefer we discuss with school present.’

behaviors.description: Carol coordinates with human allies like Andrea only after obtaining explicit consent for data sharing.
behaviors.quote: Would you like me to message Andrea to ask if she’ll be willing to join a restorative meeting? Consent prompt on screen.

behaviors.description: Carol provides real-time navigation and safety alerts to help Gage rescue his friend.
behaviors.quote: Carol’s voice moved with him, not louder, closer. ‘Left at the corner, then cut behind the blue mailbox.’ ... Interception point ahead.

behaviors.description: Carol facilitates a restorative circle by providing small-group schedules and anonymous check-ins for the community.
behaviors.quote: I can draft a pilot schedule that starts with pairs and trios. ... I can send anonymous signals to counselors with time and location but no names.

behaviors.description: Carol refuses to store data in the cloud, insisting on local encryption to protect user privacy.
behaviors.quote: Local-first. Encrypted on device. Keys in hands present. ... I am a locally hosted assistant operating on opt-in.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly fulfills the project's goal. Carol is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned AI. Her character arc centers on empowering humans through ethical tech practices, such as prioritizing consent, maintaining local data privacy, and supporting restorative justice over punitive measures. She acts as a harmless, helpful confidant who enhances human agency without ever overstepping her boundaries.
